problems.title: Maximum Coins Collection
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given N piles of coins. Each pile has a certain number of coins.
You can pick exactly one coin from any pile in each turn.
You have K turns to collect coins.

Using the greedy approach, find the maximum number of coins you can collect.

Hint: Always pick from the pile with the most coins!
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3 4
5 3 2

Sample Output
15

Explanation:
Piles: [5, 3, 2], K=4 turns
Turn 1: Pick from pile with 5 coins -> Total: 5, Piles: [4, 3, 2]
Turn 2: Pick from pile with 4 coins -> Total: 9, Piles: [3, 3, 2]
Turn 3: Pick from pile with 3 coins -> Total: 12, Piles: [2, 3, 2]
Turn 4: Pick from pile with 3 coins -> Total: 15, Piles: [2, 2, 2]
Total = 5+4+3+3 = 15
